Reviews.Title: “Overbooking in prenotazione”
Reviews.Author: Ishkocar
Reviews.Content: At the moment of checking in, they says there is "an error" with us and other clients, the hotel is FULL. They say even without excuses to go to another hotel in the vicinity, they booked there a room for us. The other Hotel was not as the previous, dirty an old and there not even know that our room was already paid in advance. Talking with people there it seems it's a routine over there to book in an hotel and sleep in another not of your choice. Be carefull.

Reviews.Title: “Optimum value for money”
Reviews.Author: TravelBOYPortugal
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice, very central, great location. 5 minutes walk from the central trucking (Piazza Roma) by the new bridge architectural and 2 min to the stop vaporeto aquabus, optimum value for money. The hotel is simple, practical and cozy rooms, some recently renovated ... breakfast is not very varied, but the price is very good. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average room, good price”
Reviews.Author: bigbozfriend
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to both Venice and Stella Alpina. The hotel is extremely well situated less than 5 minutes, even with dragging heavy bags, from the train station. It is in a small side street which is quiet. Access to the vaporetto stops is also probably a 2-4 minute walk. To walk to where the airport vaporetto leaves and arrives is maybe a 7-10 minute walk. The breakfasts were perhaps not as plentiful as our previous stay, the coffee was still great. The kitchen staff are not quite grumpy. Check in was efficent, but not friendly, only Daniella really smiled out of the receptionists. The cleanliness of the room was good, not great. We stayed in the 'suite' this time, which is really two double rooms and bathroom. The bathroom was a lot better than the previous normal double bedroom and ensuite. The tiling was good, the fittings were exceptional. Water pressure in the shower not great, but no worse than you would expect in a similar hotel in Italy. There was quite a lot of noise from the passage inside the hotel, the sound proofing of this room was not great. But, if you are looking for a clean, well priced hotel, central to whatever you need in Venice, this is ideal. If you are looking for a more upmarket experience, perhaps something else is more suitable. We have recommended this hotel to our friends who will be staying there next month and we are quite happy having done so.

Reviews.Title: “Best Indeed.”
Reviews.Author: Sonya1154
Reviews.Content: Please, if you are traveling Venice and looking for hotel to stay, choose this hotel without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “good location, excellent price, helpful staff, nice garden”
Reviews.Author: moesiuwong
Reviews.Content: good location, just less than 5 mins walk from the train station and ferry station helpful staff, large & clean & quite rooms, beautiful breakfast room, nice breakfast, nice garden no lift, but this is ok for me, better ask for ground floor or first floor rooms if carry large luggage i missunderstand the room charge from my credit and afraid of double charging when check out. Staff explain details and patients will stay again and recommand others~

Reviews.Title: “Super close to the train station, beautiful garden sitting area.”
Reviews.Author: JZais
Reviews.Content: It was so nice not having to walk far from the train station to this hotel. Keep your eyes peeled though or you might miss the super skinny street leading to the hotel. My room was nice and clean. My favourite part of the hotel apart from the location was the super cute outdoor sitting area just of of the breakfast room. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excelent price and fine staff”
Reviews.Author: Nuno Jorge P
Reviews.Content: Near the Railway station and very close where the transfers leave you, it's easy to reach. In front you have the vapporeto's and a bridge to the center. Very good

Reviews.Title: “A descent hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Deepshikha J
Reviews.Content: A bit expensive hotel for the services offered. But you are paying for the City and the Location of this hotel. It was very near to Venezia Santa Lucia train station and Water Bus station! Once you are there you would realize, it is very helpful in the city of water! ï�Š The room was clean, spacious and quiet. But we had hot water problem in the bathroom. Though they tried to fix it but they cud just manage warm water for us! As other old Venice buildings, even this hotel didnâ€™t have elevators. So be prepared to climb the steps with your luggage if you canâ€™t get ground floor! Breakfast was adequate if compared to other hotels we stayed in Italy. Internet is paid and they have just 1 old age desktop in their lobby in case u donâ€™t have ur laptop! For me, It was bit strange in this new age of Internet. On the whole pretty descent hotel with average facilities. Would recommend people who are travelling not to relax in hotel but to see Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Mitali S
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is really very convenient for those coming by the train or the vaporetto from the airport. Compared to all the people you see dragging their suitcases across multiple bridges and alleys, this hotel demands less of you! And yes, you have to climb a million steps to your room, but most old Venice buildings do not have elevators, It is also in a very quiet alleyway, while being very close to the action. The room is cute and the furniture and furnishings very Venetian. The bathroom is adequate, though the shower is super tiny. The breakfast is excellent, the sheets and rooms are clean. The customer service is indifferent. Certainly not rude, but we found that the warmth was lacking relative to what can be expected in non-European countries..Venice is small and so you can walk to St. Marks square in about 30 mins from this hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It does what is says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: liam36
Reviews.Content: Venice hotels are relatively expensive but you are in a beautiful city so the premium is worth it. This hotel was clean, quiet and comfortable, i reccomend getting a private bathroom well worth the extra. I had a double room with private bathroom, the room was spacious, clean, quiet (except for church bells in the morning - nice) and comfortable. I did not have breakfast in the hotel as there are far too many nice cafes to try out but I did stick my head into the breakfast room one morning for juice and it looked grand, plenty of food. I spent very little time in my room as there is too much to see out there. The location is great, 1 minute walk to the vaparetto station and the bustle of venice but the hotel is on a very quiet side street. The staff were very frinedly but to be honest I have very little to do with them. All in all a very enjoyable stay, i reccoment this hotel for those that want to really see venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average!!”
Reviews.Author: NikhilNarayan
Reviews.Content: It is just next to St. Lucia station. Easy to locate and ask for directions because of its proximity to the station. The rooms are small and cosy with a decent enough toilet. Compared to other hotels in Venice, the price is on the lower side. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast is the best part. It is quite nice! All in all not too bad. If you are looking budget hotel then this is one of the option.

Reviews.Title: “I'd find another place if I were you”
Reviews.Author: criticara
Reviews.Content: Room is small and hot in August. The floor was dusty. The bathtub in the bathroom had a big crack. Staff was friendly, but not enough to compensate the other weaknesses.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: greenlimo
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel are the location from the Santa Lucia train station and the breakfast. Everything else was pretty average. The room was spacious and clean, however it had a strong stale smell. I would reommend light airfreshners for the room. Also, although you are not staying in the most touristy area, the windows/walls are very thin and you can hear everything. You can hear people pulling their suticases on the street to their conversations. This was not the hotel's fault, but a property in the alley was doing construction the entire time we were there and we woke up to the sound of them working on the building promptly at 7am and they did not stop until dinner time. However, if the windows were more sound proof, this probably wouldn't have mattered. Service at the front desk was hit or miss. Two ladies were absolutely wonderful and so friendly. Another lady, not so much. You won't feel that special staying at this hotel. All of the other staff at the other hotels on our trip knew us by name and made us feel so welcome. At Hotel Stella Alpina you will feel just like a room number. The price was reasonable, for Venice, but we stayed at more affordable places throughout Italy and had better service and accomodations. If we were to return to Venice, I'd probably pay more to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain accommodation”
Reviews.Author: SweetTeacher11
Reviews.Content: Stella Alpina was a wonderful respite to the intense heat of Venice, even in very late August. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the bus station, (bussing is the easiest and least costly way to get from the airport) and even closer from the train station. There is a somewhat long bridge to navigate to get to the hotel. Even though this bridge is very new, it is in keeping with the accessibility very unfriendly nature of Venice, with no smooth side to easily pull a suitcase along, only steps. Watch for very aggressive locals wanting to carry your bags over the bridge. Stella Alpina is a hotel with a bit of a hostel feel to it. We had a room on the first floor (this is a four floor hotel with no elevator), which was not much bigger than the queen (maybe king) sized bed. But it was clean, comfortable and above all, air conditioned, with a sink in the room. Even though we shared a bathroom, and it was down the hallway, ours was only one of three units that did not have an ensuite, so access to the bathroom was never an issue. Plus, our room was the only one in this category that was air conditioned. The included breakfast was a hugely pleasing bonus, with yogourts, fresh croissants, ham, cereals and juices. Inexpensive internet access in the lobby. The hotel is very well situated, even though it is at one end of the island of Venice. The easy access to the bus and train stations (you can even walk to the cruise ship terminal) was really handy. And you have to be prepared to walk everywhere in Venice anyways. Be prepared to have nowhere to sit, since Venice does not have benches anywhere; be prepared to either pay to get into awful toilets or hold it in; be prepared for a complete lack of greenery; be prepared to be one of thousands upon thousands of tourists; be prepared for the hustle and bustle of terrific nightlife and people watching. There is good, cold water available in many spots from a fire hydrant type outlet. Wet your hat for a cooling relief for a few minutes. A highlight was the Biennale, a once every two years art festival (goes on for a few months). It is situated at the far end of Venice (from Stella Alpina) but in a parklike setting, which does not exist elsewhere in the city. Only place to have a picnic. Amazing how much cooler it was in the shade of the trees. If you are so inclined, go to a Shabbat service on Friday night (the Jewish quarter is a short walk from the hotel) and then rush over to the Gam Gam kosher restaurant and try to get into the free dinner hosted by Chabad. Super delicious with non stop singing. Venice is a fascinating city, not to be missed. 4 days was plenty of time, which included a full day at the Biennale.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NelVB
Reviews.Content: this is a no-frills, good find in beautiful, touristy Venice. Excellent location, just around the corner from the San Lucia train station, in a clean, safe alley neighborhood. Can't find a better deal for a 2-star. Breakfast was AWESOME! Woke up to fresh-baked, aromatic croissants and rolls that was truly mouth-watering and delicious. Although limited tables, we had no problem finding one when our party of four went to breakfast. Easy walk over the bridge to a laundromat, which is totally secure and safe. Grand Canal is 2 minutes walk with a phenomenal night and day view of the goings on. Staff was accommodating, but there was a misunderstanding regarding payment of the rooms. I booked online and thought I paid for both rooms, but found out the only room paid was the non-refundable room, so check to make sure what was paid. Also, the bathroom walls did have mold, which is typical in Italy for most buildings because of the stone. Didn't bother me much. No other complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brendab72
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better. It was literally just steps from the St. Lucia train station and also close the the bus station which was handy for our traveling needs. It's a very old hotel that has not been renovated (or at least our floor was not) lately, and it could use a good overall cleaning. The breakfast was better than some in Europe, but appeared that they did not replenish items when they ran out. We had to check out very early and they sent us a bagged breakfast which was nice. The street (if you can call it that) in front of the hotel is extremely noisy and it was difficult to sleep. We thought to play the TV to overcome the people noise, but it did not work and the front desk did nothing about it whlle we were there. Also one of our window shutters did not lower all the way which let in more noise and light. Overall it is overpriced for what you get, but most hotels in Venice seem to be overpriced anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet hotel on a small alley of Lista di Spagna, perfect location for the station and vaporetto stops near Scalzi Bridge. I only stayed one night as my other hotel was fully booked for my dates. the room was very clean and looked on to the garden, air con was excellent and there was an all important mosquito plug in the room, though I did have my own. Reception was efficient but not too forthcoming, they did give out great maps, better than the one I already had. Bathroom was as usual small but with every ammenity Breakfast area was lovely and a good selection of food and good coffee, the little garden was nice also to enjoy an extra cappuccino. I travel to Venice a lot and would certainly stay here again if the price was right, when i was there it was the time of the Film Festival and the Regatta so most hotels were nearly double, but for 90 euro a night this was quite a bargain for the dates, I would certainly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location, Resonable Price”
Reviews.Author: NycPhoto5
Reviews.Content: Hotel Stella Alpina is just mins walk from train station. Down a quite street this hotel was perfect for our stay. We checked in and got all the information we needed from Daniela. She was sweet and spoke perfect english and gave us a run down of the area, transport, and the hotels offerings. Confusion with what we booked and assumed we paid for was a room with air condtioning. This wasn't the case so we had to pay 13 euros for the upgrade, which was 2 floors higher than our original. This walk up & down was a lot of work, but the room had everything we needed except a tv that did not work. They couldn't fix this the 1st night and wasn't fixed till late the next, which did not seem fair to have to pay for a full upgrade without it for half the time we stayed. WiFi is not Free. Breakfast area is so nice stylish and a full spread. Really the best we had in Italy the 2 weeks and 7 hotels we stayed at. Hotel is in the perfect area, next to the river boats, cheap and good restaurants and a lot of shopping. Would recommend this place, just make sure you know what your paying for and you should be very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for a night”
Reviews.Author: traveleramanda
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is a good stay-not a 5-star hotel (actually only a 2-star on their website) but very practical for the budget conscious traveler. I was with 2 other friends from college and we were put up in a king bed/pullout couch room but the room was huge! This was the biggest room we had traveling through all of Europe. Bathrooms/showers in suite were very clean and nice. Breakfast was very good and complimentary. Like others have said this place is in a nice location because it is close to the train station so it was good for us traveling late at night not having to walk far, however, this puts you far away from the rest of the city. For example, we only stayed a night and part of a day and while we walked around all we could (and got lost :) ) I never got to see Piazza San Marco...So this means I just have a reason to go back! And yes all of the 'streets' in Venice make anything difficult to find--just go with it! Venice is a beautiful city even in winter, though there were no gondola rides...

Reviews.Title: “Great value, simple and functional”
Reviews.Author: junkbuzz
Reviews.Content: Had family room for 3 persons on ground floor, good size and view to rear garden. Front desk staff very friendly and professional. For a 2-star hotel, it was better than we expected. Best part was the great air-conditioning, worked great in the Venice heat. Kitchen staff not friendly, breakfast was standard Italian style and overall ok. Great location near train station, very good value so you can save your money for shopping or restaurants. Booked directly on hotel website with no problems, complimentary wifi for booking direct.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, easy to find”
Reviews.Author: Perth26_59
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews about hotels in Venice being hard to find I was very concious of choosing somewhere close to the main forms of transport and Stella Alpina was relatively easy to locate and is very close to the Bus Depot, Train Station and Water Taxi services. It has banks and shopping right outside as well as good and affordable eateries closeby. Breakfast is sufficient but if you like a big meal to start the day then look elsewhere. Our room with ensuite was large, clean and very comfortable, it faced onto the street but we were not bothered by any noise. Carrying suitcases up flights of stairs is very common in European accomodation so this was not really a deal breaker for us. Staff were very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel and definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A night in Venice”
Reviews.Author: D-M-Estrella
Reviews.Content: Stayed for only one night. The room was small but as expected. Near the train station, we actually came from the airport and got the bus in and walked a few blocks with our heavy luggage. It was about a 15 min walk from where the bus drops you off. We did have to drag our heavy luggage across one bridge and then since the hotel had no elevator (lift) we also had to drag our luggage up 4 levels of stairs (Not fun at all). They have a storage area you may drop off your luggage if you arrive too early like us but it was convenient that had a bathroom and shower if you needed to change after a long flight. We put locks on our luggage so we felt they were safe in that room. Service was GREAT. Breakfast was good to. We had bread (of course), ham, yogurt, cereal and yummy cappuccino. Shower was new, bathroom was average and clean. The Bed was comfortable and we had a view of the alley which brought in fresh air. Overall I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & breakfast..”
Reviews.Author: santa15
Reviews.Content: Hotel is literally just next to the railway station and it's just off the Lista di Spagna (a busy shopping street). The breakfast was good enough, not many choices, but quality is alright. i stayed in the double room with shared bathroom. The bathroom and toilets are clean all the time, but the room is a little overpriced, probably because it's the weekend. There is a weird smell in the room, which i think is the smell of damp. I would suggest not to choose this room type, when you book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Near Train Station”
Reviews.Author: chungkk
Reviews.Content: The location is good, close to train station and water bus station, but difficult to find. It's located Inside a small road opposite to the bridge. Room is big and clean. I love the hot croissants in the breakfast. The front desk staff is nice and helpful. NO free Wi-Fi NO lift, If you have big luggage, better to request the room on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for Venice trip”
Reviews.Author: bigbozfriend
Reviews.Content: Hotel is excellently located near the train station, yet in a quiet street, not on the main road. Room had FANTASTIC airconditioner in very hot conditions. Room was a good size. Shower was the typical European dribble. Shower stall small. Bidet, loo and shower all clean. Room was clean and roomy. Breakfast was very good, coffee was great. The chocolate croissants were lovely. The receptionists were helpful in providing tips for restaurants and they spoke English well. We would certainly visit there again, the rate we got for high season was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, safe and clean”
Reviews.Author: carpediem89
Reviews.Content: Desk people very nice. Good breakfast. No lift. Bathroom smelled musty. Quiet except for the church ringing bells for mass at 7:15! Had to pay for internet, but only 3 euros/hr.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Close to the Train Station”
Reviews.Author: stars_and_lipgloss
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Stella Alpina because it was one of the most inexpensive hotels I could find in Venice with good reviews. I was very pleased with our decision to stay here! The hotel is SO close to the train station, which is so convenient. I can't imagine carting our luggage throughout Venice looking for a hotel in the city center. The staff was pretty friendly, not overly friendly, but definitely not rude either. Our room was very cute. It had a sink, a double bed -which was two twin beds pushed together (not the most romantic), a dresser and an armoire. It was clean except for the floor under the bed and in the corners. Every time something would get pushed under the bed, it would be covered in dust. Our floor was eerily quiet! I didn't hear or see another person during our stay. It was perfect because there are communal bathrooms and showers so there were no lines, and no waiting for the shower. Breakfast was really good and included in the stay!! There were croissants, rolls, butter, jam, nutella, cereal, teas, coffees, juices etc. It was definitely better than the breakfast served at most lower budget hotels and it was great to not have to go searching for food in the morning. There was a computer near the breakfast area but the staff said that the internet was down so nobody was allowed on it. I recommend going to eat at the restaurant "Brek" right down the street (within 2-3 min walking max)!! The food was not amazing but it was good and very cheap!! You can get a large carafe of wine for 3 euro! We ate here every night. Perfect if you're on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Drab and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: city2surfer1961
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the train station, and very convenient for discovering Venice, there really is nothing else to recommend this hotel. It is ridiculously overpriced, the rooms are drab, there is no tea or coffee making facilities, no fridge, a portable TV and a very small bathroom. We stayed in all types of places on our trip to Italy, this place was the most expensive and without a doubt the worst. Breakfast in the dining room was ok, even though it is not an overly large room and can be quite busy. I suppose if you are going to Venice, you are not spending much time in your hotel room, you want to be out and about soaking up the fact that you are in one of the worlds most romantic cities, for the price though you can do much better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LorraineCopa
Reviews.Content: Two mins walk to ferry stop on Grand Canal, two mins to Station and restaurants were in the same street. We found staff very cooperative and couldn't get better loacation. Quiet room looking onto inner garden. Good breakfast, made you one to take with you if you had to leave early. You had to apy for wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel, not overpriced, close to the train station and all public transport. IDEAL!”
Reviews.Author: spikejde
Reviews.Content: A two minutes walk from the station and all public transport. Buy a "water bus" ticket for the period of your visit. You can jump on and off the "buses" and see part of Venice difficult to access. The hotel is fine, ideally placed. All we could find to moan about was the breakfast choice - no cheese, eggs or toast, so a little limited We did the Walking and Grand Canal boat tours and well worthe the money as we were only in Venice for two days Go to LIdo for an afternoon trip...very relaxing

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near the RR station”
Reviews.Author: pilgrim324
Reviews.Content: The Stella Alpina Edelweiss is very close to the railway station so you don't have to drag your luggage halfway to St. Marks. I thought that the room was a good size and the beds were great. Breakfast was good and well stocked. It is in the first little calle to the left of the RR station so don't walk too far. It was the most expensive place we stayed on the trip but we needed a nice and roomy place by this time. There are plenty of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Average place, very close to the Santa Lucia Railway station.”
Reviews.Author: HarshwardhanGupta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very narrow lane next to the station. We missed it the first time. Everything is within walking distance, and a 24H boat ticket with a nice map is a convenient way to move around in Venice, Murano and Burano. One of those boat routes takes you past the Venezia harbour, where you can often see grand liners at anchor. We saw the massive 3600 berth Ruby Princess, lit up like a Christmas tree in the night. The rooms were nice and clean, though there was no lift, the hotel being on the venetian islands where no building modification is allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Economy Choice near RR Station”
Reviews.Author: Rover4
Reviews.Content: Stayed in three different 2-star hotels on recent trip to Italy, and this was by far the best. Friendly and personal service. Excellent, bountiful breakfast which we took out to the peaceful, shaded garden...surely the most tranquil spot in Venice! Our large twin room was upstairs on the front but was quiet. Some rooms on ground level overlook garden. Loved the proximity to Piazzale Roma and RR Station -- an easy transition with luggage. Hotel gladly stored our bags in locked closet until check-in. Will definitely be returning to this Venetian gem!

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto, for convenience and price!”
Reviews.Author: MLKen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here three days prior to a cruise and returned for one night following it. We couldn't have been happier. The staff was very helpful and friendly. On both occasions having arrived earlier than check-in they stored our luggage in a locked room as others have mentioned. The first time we could have taken a twin bed room that was ready, but we wanted a double bed, so upon return we then were given an upgrade to a junior suite (#6) with two rooms, ensuite bathroom, as it was not booked during our stay. How nice! It was on the street side and we loved watching the people go by and hearing the night sounds - everything reverberated off the walls, so maybe not good for light sleepers, but we were always tired enough we slept fine. It was just an incredible slice of Venice! Breakfast was perfect for us - juice, croissants, bread, etc. that meant we did not have to go looking for food and started us off on our day. Our last visit when we were checking out at 4:30 AM they gave us a packed breakfast to take the night before so we could actually pack it in our bags as we wanted. We were fortunate that our room the first time was on the 1st floor - not too difficult with our bags (I can see where having to go up higher would be difficult, but most hotels in Venice do not have elevators from what I understand) The second time we were on the ground floor facing the breakfast garden (#54). Both of these rooms were obviously newly rennovated and really above what we'd expected for a 2 star hotel. It could not have been more convenient to get to from P. Roma and we loved walking to the main attractions from there as it allowed us to get to know the city pretty well. All we can say is we were more than pleased with our choice and stay at Stella Alpina and would stay again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “very convenient for rail and air travellers”
Reviews.Author: Ros61
Reviews.Content: Just near the reailway station and a skip from ple roma. Reception staff and very helpful. Unfortunately our room was just ok overlooked the narrow calle and very noisey, air con didnt have a controller but that was fixed. shower dribbled, plugs in bidet and sink didnt work. Breakfasts were ok but the self service drinks machine lacked taste. Anyone who doesnt want to drag there luggage around venice would find this hotel ok. We would you again for short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for that price, excelent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sotakinsh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and were very happy about our choice. Hotel has excelent location. It is located very near to the train station (about 200m), but we didn't hear trains at all. We had room on the first floor with windows to garden. It was very quiet there and we didn't hear our neighbours. The only problem is that windows are very thin. It may be problem if you will be given the room with windows to street (althought street is small and not busy), but I am pretty sure that almost all hotels in Venice has thin windows. The breakfast was good. Room was clean and of medium size. Bathroom was of good size. Double bed was big and comfortable. Room had heater/airconditioner. Staff was very friendly and on our last day they allowed us to leave our bags in lockable hotel luggage room without any charge. If you are going to visit Venice, I suggest to stay there for at least 3 days in low or middle season and at least 4 days in high season. The 72h public transport ticket costs 33 EUR, but if you'r under 29yrs then you can buy Rolling Venice Card for 4 EUR and 72h public transport ticket at reduced price 18 EUR. With Rolling Venice Card you will get many other discounts at shops, hotels, museums, restaurants etc. If you will travel to other city by train, I suggest you to buy tickets at ticket machine (ticket machines doesn't give change), because at ticket office you will have to pay additional charge which may be as big as the price of the ticket. Some tickets before use must be validated in special machines or by train staff.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to explore Venice from..”
Reviews.Author: rand0mr0amer
Reviews.Content: The location was 1 min from train station and a quick walk to the bus station. Water buses closer than the train. The staff were friendly and the fresh breakfast in the morning was excellent, we loved the grapefruit juice! The room was warm , clean and comfortable. Good value for money. Murano island was worth the visit and quick and easy from the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Stella Alpina Edelweiss
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio, Calle Priuli, 99/D, 30121 Venice, Italy
